Detailed Description

template<class SearchState>
class SearchPathBase< SearchState >

Base class for searched A* state paths.

Each instance has access to current state, the next state, and the destination state. When the path is to be queried, clients call the matches() method with their current state and their intended destination state.

template<class SearchState>
bool SearchPathBase< SearchState >::isValid (  )  const [inline]

Return true if we have a valid path.

This means that we have at least a current state and the destination state.

template<class SearchState>
bool SearchPathBase< SearchState >::matches ( const SearchState &  src,
const SearchState &  dst 
)

Return true if the given search states correspond to what is stored in this search path.

The current node is advanced if the given source node is equivalent to the path's next node.

template<class SearchState>

Return the current search state, or NULL if the path is invalid.

template<class SearchState>

Return our destination search state.

template<class SearchState>
const SearchState* SearchPathBase< SearchState >::pNext (  )  const [inline]

Return the next search state (which might be the destination), or NULL if the path is invalid.

template<class SearchState>
void SearchPathBase< SearchState >::pop (  )  [inline]

Proceed to the next search state.

This means that the previous next state is now our new current state.

template<class SearchState>
virtual bool SearchPathBase< SearchState >::statesAreEquivalent ( const SearchState &  s1,
const SearchState &  s2 
) const [pure virtual]

This method returns true if the two given search states are equivalent.

Subclasses must supply this method.

Implemented in ChunkWaypointSetStatePath, and ChunkWaypointStatePath.
